instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message: I had a bit of spillage on the board but nothing around smc or charging Ic. What diode reading should I be getting around <CAPACITOR>C7117</CAPACITOR> (<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL>)  Im getting 0.113v on diode. Im  getting 8.6v on <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> pin 5

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message:
That value is good.

Do you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?
Check it without battery.

Check <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> and post voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.59v without battery

<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> is fine at 10k
Scl/Sda lines are 0.445v diode mode and 3.3v on both

I dont have another battery to verify if battery is bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message:
"... post voltage ..."
???

You should discard battery, to avoid wasting time with an working board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message: As this had water damage as previous mentioned I wanted to make sure board was reading ok before buying a battery as they are expensive and I dont see many 11" mac air's.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message:
Find an old battery, just for test.
Must be known good working, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message: Thanks for your input I have ordered a new battery and will work from there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not detecting battery
threads.message:
Be aware of new chinese battery!
I saw too many problems caused by these bulshits...
